subject: Football
lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. has proposed playing two regular-season games outside the United States starting in 2008, league officials said yesterday. Mark Waller, head of N.F.L. international development, said the proposal was put to team owners Tuesday in Denver. It came after the 49ers and the Cardinals played last October before a record crowd of 103,000 in Mexico City. The owners will discuss the issue again in October. The games would be played in Mexico, Canada, Britain and Germany, where five of the six N.F.L. Europe teams play.
